page.title: 08The Kennels, Exford.
page.content: The Devon and Somerset Staghounds moved to Exford in 1875.The huntsman is in charge of the Kennels where all the hounds are kept. He has about 70 couples,he knows them all individually and they come when he calls their name.Local farmers give carcases (cows struck by lightning etc.)to feed the hounds flesh and otherwise they eat a pudding made from cereals and fat.The puppies are looked after by hunt supporters until they are old enough to be trained.This is done by the huntsman and requires a lot of time and patience.When the hounds get older their feet flatten and they cannot keep up with the pack.They make a babbling sound which is an attempt to keep the young ones back,so then they are not allowed to hunt anymore.
